intro: Leretia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf leretia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
